alert.note: Alert for Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 03 at 8:21PM MST until August 03 at 9:45PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Dust Advisory for... South central Cochise County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 945 PM MST. * At 819 PM MST, areas of blowing dust is located along a line extending from 13 miles north of Bisbee-Douglas Airport to 12 miles southeast of Tombstone, moving north at 10 to 20 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Route 181 between mile markers 39 and 46. Route 191 between mile markers 17 and 45. Locations impacted include... Pearce-Sunsites, Elfrida, Sunizona and McNeal. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
